Specific Details: Immigration reform
DPOs Lobbied: Donnchadh Ó Laoghaire|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Seán Sherlock|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Immigration reform
Intended Results: Highlighting the ways the current immigration system is not working effectively or efficiently for many migrants
Lobbying Activities: Meeting with shadow justice spokesperson Deputy Donnchadh Ó Laoghaire to discuss the need for immigration reform. We are promoting the need to ‘plan not react’ to current inward migration, which is only set to increase, whatever the route (resettlement, relocation, seeking international protection and more regularised flows). We also want to see greater clarity on visa and stamps for new arrivals as currently there lack of clarity and too much discretion means current system is both opaque and not fair.|Meeting|1::Invitation to meet Deputy Seán Sherlock to discuss immigration reform.|Letter|1

Specific Details: Discussion of EU Migration Pact, reception conditions for international protection applicants and beneficiaries of temporary protection
DPOs Lobbied: Donnchadh Ó Laoghaire|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas
Subject Matter: Discussion of EU Migration Pact, reception conditions for international protection applicants and beneficiaries of temporary protection
Intended Results: We sought support for a clear residency scheme post the Temporary Protection Directive for Ukrainians in Ireland. We also highlighted concerns relating to the future implementation of the EU Migration Pact in Ireland and the impact of the designation of countries as safe countries on international protection applicants.
Lobbying Activities:
Virtual meeting to discuss migration policy|Virtual Meeting|1::1 x email sent on 03rd May to highlight concerns re reduction of social welfare payments to beneficiaries of temporary protection.
